description: Construction of a three storey building comprising twelve self-contained flats; internal access road, parking and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces as shown on the approved plans of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.8 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, Supplementary Planning Guidance 9: Trees and Development Guidelines, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | Before any development is commenced, a method statement to BS 5837:2005 and in accordance with the recommendations of the tree report (prepared by Phelps Associates, received 17.01.2008) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall thereafter be carried out only in accordance with the approved method statement.   Reason: To ensure that the ongoing health and vitality of existing trees and to ensure the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 4.8 of Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, the Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 9: Tress and Development Guidelines, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment (including any internal boundary fences / walls) to be erected. The approved boundary treatment shall be completed before the buildings are occupied permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area in accordance with policies 3.1, 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, Supplementary Planning Guidance 9: Trees and Development Guidelines, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved drawings, all footpaths must be at least 1.8 metres wide, paved in contrasting paving (to the vehicle carriageway) and be level with the vehicle access area.   Reason: To ensure that adequate and safe pedestrian routes are provided within the site, in accordance with policy 9.9 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 6.10 and 7.4 of the London Plan (2011). | The internal vehicular and pedestrian access as approved by the Local Planning Authority shall be constructed before first occupation of any part of the development hereby permitted and thereafter retained permanently.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate and satisfactory provision for vehicular and pedestrian access within the site is provided in accordance with policies 4.1, 9.1 and 9.9 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 6.1 and 7.4 of the London Plan (2011). | The visitor car parking spaces shown on the approved drawing (no title) received 06.02.2008 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking is made within the site in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policy 6.1 of the London Plan (2011). | Refuse and recycling storage areas indicated on approved drawing (no title) received 06.02.2008 shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the visual amenity and character of the area in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1 and 4.8 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 4: Refuse and Recycling Facilities, and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy. | Before the development is commenced a detailed site investigation shall be carried out to establish if the site is contaminated, to assess the degree and nature of the contamination present, and to determine its potential for the pollution of the water environment.  The method and extent of this investigation shall be agreed with the Local Planning Authority and also in consultation with the National Rivers Authority prior to the commencement of the work. Details of appropriate measure to remove contaminated material and to prevent pollution of ground water and surface water, including provisions for monitoring, shall then be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development commences.  The development shall then proceed in strict accordance with the measures approved.  Reason:  To remove contamination from the site and to prevent pollution of the water environment in accordance with policies 2.7, 4.1 and 5.5 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policy 5.21 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of all external lighting, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institute of Lighting Engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution" and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9 must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in consultation with Network Rail, prior to the commencement of the approved development.  The lighting as approved must be permanently retained in accordance with these details.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and to ensure the lighting does not affect Network Rails signaling systems, in accordance with policies 4.4 and 4.12 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy. | The cycle parking shown on the approved drawing (no title) received 06.02.2008, shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To provide and retain adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2011). | Details of measures for protecting the building envelope (roof, walls and windows) from external noise, vibration, including aircraft noise, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The works shall be carried out as approved before first occupation and shall thereafter be retained.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11 and 5.5 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration', policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2011). | There shall be no obstruction above 0.6m in height at any time within pedestrian visibility splay areas at the back line of the footway/access road that measure 1.5m deep and 1.5m wide at either side of the vehicular crossover. The new access point as approved shall be constructed before any part of the development permitted is first occupied or brought into use and the pedestrian visibility splays shall be permanently retained in the form described in this condition.  Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policy 6.1 of the London Plan (2011). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers, in accordance with policy 5.3 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 7: Accessible Ealing, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policy 7.2 of the London Plan (2011). | At least one of the residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Wheelchair Housing standards and permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure suitable accommodation for disabled persons, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing', policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policy 7.2 of the London Plan (2011). | The design of the building shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Secured By Design award before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements in accordance with policy 4.4 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, Supplementary Planning Guidance 8: 'Safer Ealing', policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2011). | No development shall commence until details of a site construction method statement/management plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:  a) proposed on-site construction worker parking b) anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site c) delivery times (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods) d) dust suppression measures e) wheel washing provisions f) site security during construction g) construction vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. h) procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents i) details of how the temporary vehicular access road will be removed and re-instated, and the timing of such works  Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason:  In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers of the site and the users of the neighbouring highway in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11 and 9.9 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2011). | No machinery, plant, openings or ducts shall be installed on any elevations without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers in accordance with policy 4.1 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the details of energy efficiency given within the 'Sustainability Statement', received 18.12.2007, details of energy efficient design and consideration of on-site equipment for renewable power generation for the buildings so that at least 10% of all energy requirements within the resulting development are sourced from renewable energy resources, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates energy efficiency measures, in accordance with policy 2.9 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004.  Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates energy efficiency measures, in accordance with policy 2.9 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 5.7 of the London Plan (2011). | Arrangements shall be put in place throughout the duration of the building works to clean the wheels of vehicles leaving the site and to ensure the security of any loads being removed from the site. These measures shall be put into effect on each vehicle leaving the site.  Reason: To prevent the spread of mud and dirt on the adjoining roads, in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 4.1 and 9.1 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Core Strategy, and policy 7.4 of the London Plan (2011).
